title: Equations of Motion
content:
Equations of Motion

The Hook

How does a ISRO rocket scientist calculate exactly how fast a rocket moves after a 10-second burn? They use the equations of motion — three simple formulas that describe any object moving with constant acceleration!

The Concept

The three equations of motion are: (1) v = u + at, (2) s = ut + ½at², (3) v² = u² + 2as. Here u = initial velocity, v = final velocity, a = acceleration, t = time, s = displacement. These only work when acceleration is constant (uniform).

The Illustration

A cyclist starts from rest (u=0) and accelerates at 2 m/s² for 5 seconds. Using v = u + at: v = 0 + 2×5 = 10 m/s. Distance covered: s = 0×5 + ½×2×25 = 25 m. These same equations help engineers design safe stopping distances for Chennai's metro trains!
